events.message: The customer filed a claim reporting a vehicle accident that took place on 2024-04-30 involving a collision with another car.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the report indicating damage to the insured vehicle after a road collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this auto accident claim to ensure smooth communication and proper investigation.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer about the next steps in the review process.
Documents including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and the customer’s driver’s license were requested to proceed with claim assessment.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly which included the police accident report and detailed pictures of the car damage.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted the customer for additional clarifications.
The investigation concluded that the vehicle damage resulted from the collision as described; liability was assessed accordingly.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering the repair costs and rental car reimbursement for the duration of repairs.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and confirmed their acceptance via email.
The claim was officially approved in light of the accepted settlement and all documentation meeting the policy requirements.
Settlement payment was issued promptly to the customer’s account to cover the vehicle repair expenses as per the approved claim.
Following the payment issuance, the claim was closed successfully with no further actions required from the customer.
The claim documents were archived in the company’s system for future reference and compliance purposes.
